t: Psalm 74
Arise, O God, Defend Your Cause
A Maskil of Asaph.
O*pn God, why do you cast us off forever? Why*ld does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?
Remember*ln your congregation, which you have purchased of old, which*ld you have redeemed to be the tribe of your heritage! Remember*ld Mount Zion, where you have dwelt.
Direct*ln your steps to the perpetual ruins; the*ld enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary!
Your*pn foes have roared in the midst of your meeting place; they*ld set up their own signs for signs.
They*ln were like those who swing axes in*ld a forest of trees.
And*ln all its carved wood they*ld broke down with hatchets and hammers.
They*ln set your sanctuary on fire; they*ld profaned the dwelling place of your name, bringing*ld it down to the ground.
They*ln said to themselves, “We will utterly subdue them”; they*ld burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
We*pn do not see our signs; there*ld is no longer any prophet, and*ld there is none among us who knows how long.
How*ln long, O God, is the foe to scoff? Is*ld the enemy to revile your name forever?
Why*ln do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take*ld it from the fold of your garment and destroy them!
Yet*pn God my King is from of old, working*ld salvation in the midst of the earth.
You*ln divided the sea by your might; you*ld broke the heads of the sea monsters on the waters.
You*ln crushed the heads of Leviathan; you*ld gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
You*ln split open springs and brooks; you*ld dried up ever-flowing streams.
Yours*ln is the day, yours also the night; you*ld have established the heavenly lights and the sun.
You*ln have fixed all the boundaries of the earth; you*ld have made summer and winter.
Remember*pn this, O Lord,*s how the enemy scoffs, and*ld a foolish people reviles your name.
Do*ln not deliver the soul of your dove to the wild beasts; do*ld not forget the life of your poor forever.
Have*pn regard for the covenant, for*ld the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.
Let*ln not the downtrodden turn back in shame; let*ld the poor and needy praise your name.
Arise,*pn O God, defend your cause; remember*ld how the foolish scoff at you all the day!
Do*ln not forget the clamor of your foes, the*ld uproar of those who rise against you, which goes up continually!
